title: Quantifier elimination
summary: Quantifier elimination is a concept of simplification used in mathematical logic, model theory, and theoretical computer science. Informally, a quantified statement " ∃ x {\displaystyle \exists x} such that … {\displaystyle \ldots } " can be viewed as a question "When is there an x {\displaystyle x} such that … {\displaystyle \ldots } ?", and the statement without quantifiers can be viewed as the answer to that question.[1]
